[Chart archive – March 1997 to date]

This week: 17 new entries, 0 climbers, 0 non-movers & 23 downers. new entry re-entry climber faller non moverCHART TIME !

(* – my current favourites)

(!!! – Single Of The Week!!!)

(:O === the current all-time hate that makes even my smilie want to hurl!)

( (R) – Repeat., ie. a re-release)

Of this week’s highlights and lowlights…Bowling for Soup: 1985

[A Hangover

You Don’t Deserve] 35 Bowling for Soup – 1985

A lazy attempt to write a song by singing about a certain year, even if it does spoof things likeRobert Palmer’s “Addicted To Love” video which was RELEASED IN 1986!!! And the spoof of George Michael’s”Faith”, released later in 1987.

Big Brovaz:

Yours Fatally

[prev. album: Nu Flow] 33 (15) Big Brovaz – Yours Fatally

I hate this band with their crappy attempts at R&B. Thankfully, their record company have seen the lighttoo, and dumped them. Expect them to split up.

Eamon: Love Them

[I Don’t Want You Back] 27 Eamon – Love Them

A shit rap on top of the backing music of Gilbert O’Sullivan’s I Only Have Eyes For You. If you buy this,then you’re shit too.

Marilyn Manson:

Personal Jesus

[Lest We Forget:

Best Of CD+DVD] 13 Marilyn Manson – Personal Jesus

He made a good stab at covering Tainted Love, making it his own, but this cover is a very pedestrianversion and a carbon copy and has nothing to merit it above the fantastic original.

Good Charlotte: Predictable

[The Chronicles

of Life & Death] 12 Good Charlotte – Predictable

A decent single for a change from these weird-looking rockers, with a track that actually createsan atmosphere to match the melody and shouting vocals.

Angel City: Do You Know

[Love Me Right] 8 Angel City – Do You Know

A dull song set to the excellent backtrack of Robert Miles’ ambient 1996 hit Children. Just what thefuck are Angel City playing at? Avoid and get the original instead!

Duran Duran: …Sunrise

[Astronaut] 5 Duran Duran – (Reach Up For The) Sunrise

Their first decent single in 11 years, they’ve returned with a corker for their comeback which has asmuch energy as many of their hits from the ’80s. Now let’s have another ‘The Chauffeur’ please 🙂

Khia:

My Neck, My Back 4 Khia – My Neck, My Back (Lick It)

The uncensored version goes: “My neck, my back, lick my pussy and my crack”

It’ll be interesting to see if any of that gets shown on TV.

Rachel Stevens:

More More More

[Funky Dory] 3 Rachel Stevens – More More More

A desperate attempt to stay in the charts with a desperate hairdo and a desperate cover version.

Please go away, Rachel. Hannah Spearmint was far cuter 🙂

Robbie Williams: Radio

[Greatest Hits] 1 Robbie Williams – Radio *1st Week at No.1*

Why is it that the more hyped the first new single in a while by some artists is, and the more moneythey’ve thrown at the video, the less memorable and uninspiring the song itself comes across?

I’d like to have hoped that the brainwashed single-buying public hadn’t fallen for it again, butsomehow I knew they would…

Still, now Robbie’s dumped his songwriter, I wish him all the chart-singing success in Gary Barlow’s world!

This is the 17th new single to go straight in at No.1 in a row:

1. Usher – Yeah!

2. McFly – Five Colours in Her Hair

3. Eamon – Fuck It

4. Frankee – FURB (Fuck You Right Back)

17. Robbie Williams – Radio
